moves.2. Nf3 g6: Black goes for a kingside fianchetto.
moves.3... Bg7 4. Qa4: !? More natural moves include 4. d4, 4. Nf3, and 4. g3.
moves.4... O-O 5. Qxd7: ?? GM Huebner blunders his queen, perhaps he thought he was playing black.
moves.6. g4: ? White weakens his kingside and gives up a pawn without compensation. This is unsound.
moves.6... Qxd2+: ?? Unfortunately Black misses the free pawn and blunders.
moves.7. Kxd2 Nxg4: This is the right move, but it was played one move too late.
moves.8. b4: ?? White leaves his rook en prise.
moves.9. a4: ?? White does not see the attack...
moves.12... axb4: ?? draw agreed. "This incident was in the nature of a protest because Huebner had many adjournments pending and he wanted to rest. But his captain assigned him to play against the Americans, telling him that a quick draw would be acceptable." -- Pal Benko

gameName: What happens when you play for a draw?
